titlepage.titleproper: Register of the European subject collection, 1890-2009
Register of the European subject collections
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Collection Summary

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: 16 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 1 phonotape cassette

did.abstract: Pamphlets, leaflets, serial issues, proclamations, reports, certificates, correspondence, election campaign literature, video tapes, and memorabilia, relating to various aspects of twentieth-century European history and politics, and especially to the socialist movement in Europe between the two world wars, post-World War II efforts to promote European cooperation and unity, and elections to the European Parliament.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], European subject collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives. An increment was added in 2011.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Pamphlets, leaflets, serial issues, proclamations, reports, certificates, correspondence, election campaign literature, video tapes, and memorabilia, relating to various aspects of twentieth-century European history and politics, and especially to the socialist movement in Europe between the two world wars, post-World War II efforts to promote European cooperation and unity, and elections to the European Parliament.
Bulletins, pamphlets, serial issues, maps and other printed matter relating to miscellaneous aspects of European political, social and cultural life.

dsc.head: Container List
dsc.p: SEE CARD CATALOG FOR INCREMENTS THAT MAY HAVE BEEN RECEIVED AFTER DEC. 1994

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous. Bulletins, pamphlets, serial issues, maps, and printed matter, 1902-1981, relating to miscellaneous aspects of various European countries. In English, French, German, Czech, and Spanish Anti-communist movements. Pamphlet issued by the Bureau Permanent de l'Entente Internationale contre la IIIe Internationale, entitled "Neuf ans de lutte contre le bolchevisme," 1933. In French
General. Reprint of a speech by Hubert Ripka delivered on 28 April 1955 and relating to the status of Central and Eastern Europe before the Four Powers Conference. In French
Human rights. Pamphlet, 1966, published by the Assembly of Captive European Nations and relating to human rights violations in Central and Eastern Europe
Oder-Neisse-Line. Reprint of a legal study by Herbert Kraus, 1954, relating to the history of the Oder- Neisse-Line. In German
European civilization. Pamphlet by Jean Kanapa entitled "L'Etat de siege; voila le dernier mot de votre civilisation!" 1950? relating to post World War II European politics
Booklet, 1986, relating to the 25th anniversary of the European Social Charter
Circular issued by the German Information Center in New York, 1988, relating to the Unified Market of 1992
Election material for the parliamentary elections

Maastricht Treaty. Brochures, flyers, leaflets, newsletters, and magazine and newspaper issues relating to the French referendum of October 15, 1992, on the Maastricht Treaty on European unification. Includes the text of the treaty as distributed to the French voters. In French
International Commission Against Concentration Camp Practices, Brussels. Report, 1950

North Atlantic Treaty Organization. Two copies of the Declaration of Paris, adopted in Paris by the Atlantic Convention of NATO Nations on January 19, 1962; and a flyer describing the Supreme Headquarters Allied Powers Europe (SHAPE), n.d. (in English)
Security. Pamphlets, newsletters, and a Rand Corporation study, 1988-1990, relating to the future of European security, the INF treaty, and the Warsaw Pact

Socialism. Reports, leaflets, pamphlets, and newspaper issues, l923-l946, relating to the 3rd and 4th Congresses of the Labour and Socialist International, activities of socialist parties and their social, cultural and labor affiliates in Germany, Austria, and Czechoslovakia in the interwar period, and activities of Czech socialists in England during World War II

Socialist youth. Newsletters of the World Federation of Democratic Youth and of the International Committee of the Children's and Adolescents' Movements, attached to the WFDY, 1984-1985; and of International Union of Students, 1978
Spaak, Paul-Henri. Reprint of an article by Andri Visson published in The American Mercury, November 1946
Booklet, 1986, relating to the Dutch language
Pamphlets and serial issues, 1978-1984, relating to the disarmament movement in the Netherlands. In Dutch
Scandinavia. Serial issues, proceedings of congresses, and underground literature, l890-l949, relating to politics, socialism, and the peace movement in Scandinavia. In Swedish and Danish

scopecontent.p: This addition to the collection has not yet been described. Please let the Hoover Institution Archives know if you would like to see this material described. Contact us at hooverarchivesinfo@stanford.edu
